text: The Boar's Head Inn was an inn at Southwark in London, owned by Sir John Fastolf, who is the source for the character-name of Falstaff. While the Eastcheap Boar's Head Inn is not known to have existed during the reign of Henry IV, this inn may have. ==References== Category:Demolished buildings and structures in London Category:Former buildings and structures in the London Borough of Southwark Category:Pubs in the London Borough of Southwark Category:Former pubs in London
title: Boar's Head Inn, Southwark
